name: N,N-dibenzylhydroxylamine
Reason: 1,2-propanediol base melting point is around 50 degrees Celsius. Two phenyl groups are present, which would significantly increase the melting point due to the ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C. Additionally, the presence of a hydroxylamine group can participate in hydrogen bonding, which may raise the melting point by approximately +10°C. The ketone group introduces polar carbonyl interactions, contributing approximately +40°C.
